text: I think because I became a mom later in life, everything in life means more.
author: Mariska Hargitay

text: My mom was sarcastic about men. She would tell me Adam was the rough draft and Eve was the final product. She was a feminist minister, an earth mom who wore a bra only on Sundays.
author: Daphne Zuniga

text: I'm a soccer mom. I'm T-ball, soccer, karate, homework, keeping them on their schedules. I love being the snack mom, when I get to bring the cut oranges. I have one of those coolers with wheels. I'm at every game, every practice, sitting on my blanket. I love it.
author: Pamela Anderson

text: Many of my books come from what if questions that I can't answer, things that I'm worried about as either a woman, a wife, a mom, an American.
author: Jodi Picoult

text: My dad sold encyclopedias and my mom worked in a factory office.
author: Mike Myers
